data.title: It's ok
data.text:
First Impression… Parking. We met up there at 6 pm and there was no where to park. They only have a few parking spaces. We parked next door. We went inside and it smelled like a bathroom. There were only a few customers inside. There was 1 person in the kitchen and 1 person waiting tables. Despite the smell we went ahead and sat down. We ordered Chips & Salsa (but the catch is that you have to pay for it) . Definitely didn’t like that. That’s the first Mexican restaurant that I have ever been to were I had to pay for chips & dip. Would I order them again? No. Don’t get me wrong, they weren’t bad. I just wouldn’t pay for them again. We went ahead and ordered the rest of our food. The food tasted great. The prices were good. The service wasn’t bad. Overall I would give them 3 out of 5 stars. 

For more reviews check my blog Delakc

data.title: Good local Mexican
data.text: Nothing fancy, but good Mexican and something different. Fajitas were good and $3 Margaritas were excellent on Thirsty Thursdays. Chips are extra, but that is OK since I eat to many at other Mexican stops.

data.title: Nice Evening Out
data.text: Tried this place cause it was close for both couples. Ordered Chips & Salsa and Guac..that way we got PLENTY of chips. Street Tacos were a lot bigger than most places. I got tamales (how I judge mexican places) I would say just average, not great, not bad. I will have the tacos next time!! Mango margaritas were 2 for 1...YES!! Very good! I have to  say the little girl who works at serving and taking orders is sweet & hekpful and WAY overworked! She did great! And they all have a smile on their face! I dont know what region of Mexico their food is based, has a little different flavor & tang than most but good. I'll come back soon!

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Stopped in for lunch with a co-worker, who recommend it and was not disappointed.  I got the Supreme burrito and it was delicious. I will definitely be back.

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food was Good.
data.text: We went to Fogones with another couple on a Friday night. It  wasn't too busy and we were seated right away. Disappointed that the chips and dip were not complimentary. We ordered chips, salsa, and Churiito/Quesa dip which was good - not outstanding. Their regular salsa is bland, you have to request the hotter sauce. We all ordered  pork/black bean burrito, steak and chicken fajitas, tacos and a tostada. The plates came to the table looking like Cooking Channel. Great presentation. The food was not quite equal to the presentation. The atmosphere is dark, the restaurant is small; there is some patio seating but it was too cold for us. Rating Mexican restaurants we like, Fogones is probaby fourth on our list. Good but not great.

data.title: First Visit. Shocked
data.text: Thought we would stop by as we live in Shawnee. Wasn't that impressed with the queso and we thought Oh No. We ordered. I ordered the tamales and hubby ordered the Diablo.  Wow first presentation is amazing. Looks gourmet but yet authentic Mexican food. This place is GREAT. We will of be back.  The owner is also the chef Jose!

data.title: Outstanding Mexican Food
data.text:
After reading a few disparaging reviews of Fogones, I wanted to weigh in with a second review.
First off, if you are concerned about coupons and big discounts, perhaps Taco Bell will save you some money.
Secondly, the waitresses may not always be world class, but Chef Jose in the kitchen is the one constant that makes this all worth while.
Today I had a Pork Burrito, and it was excellent. The presentation is superb and the ingredients are all very fresh. It is apparent that Jose loves to cook and his food reflects this.
Do yourself a favor and stop into Fogones soon!

data.title: Great overlooked location
data.text: We went there close to the time that they had just opened so a little disorganized.  With that being said the food was good. I know that I see a lot of traffic ther during lunch and dinner.

data.title: Great place in downtown Shawnee
data.text: First time to eat here.  What a pleasant experience and a great "find".  Pork burrito was excellent, one of the best I've ever eaten. Lots of food for the price.

data.title: Craptastic
data.text: Do not visit will not accept entertainment book coupons! Very disagreeable staff NO CUSTOMER IS RIGHT HERE!

data.title: Never Again....
data.text: We tried this place today for the first time.  Even though it was close to our work, we weren’t familiar with it, and learned about it from a coupon in the new Entertainment Book.  The coupon was for buy one get one free entrée.  We checked the online menu and the food looked fantastic, so off we went.  Immediately upon entering we were taken aback, not only because of the rundown and dirty appearance of the restaurant, but because it didn’t smell like food, but like mildew and what can only be described as wet dog.  It was just odd to walk into a restaurant and not smell food.  The waitress took our drink orders and when the drinks arrived they tasted like turpentine.  The waitress said ‘Yeah, I don’t like diet soda either’.  We finally convinced her to get us new drinks, which weren’t any better.  While waiting on our food we asked about chips and salsa, only to be told that would be an additional $2.50.  No thanks.  We were about ready to just leave when our food showed up.  It was amazing.  I have no idea how these beautiful plates were put together in this place.  The meals looked amazing.  We were in shock as we started to eat.  OMG!  The food was insanely good!  We kept commenting to each other that there was no way we expected food of this caliber, due to the restaurant itself and the wait staff.  Granted, my order was wrong, I received pork instead of chicken in my burrito, but the food was so good we just didn’t care!  We were already planning on bringing our friends in, because we knew they would also be shocked at how good the food was, compared to how horrible we expected it to be.  At the end of the meal we were stuffed and happy, and told the waitress we had a coupon.  “No, you don’t”, was her reply.  Excuse me?  “We don’t have coupons”.  I showed her that the coupon had the restaurant’s name, address, and phone number on it, a partial menu on the back, and even a survey to fill out about the restaurant and service, and that it has an expiration date of 12/20/2015.  “I don’t know where people are getting these.  We don’t have coupons on our website, and we don’t take coupons.  This is the 4th one this week”.  In shock over how rudely she dismissed the coupon, with no apology, no offer to let us speak to a manager, nothing, we explained that this was our first visit, that we wouldn’t have known about the place if it wasn’t for the coupon, and that we enjoyed the meal and planned to return, but that if the coupon wasn’t honored that we wouldn’t be back.  It’s just the principle of the thing.  We drove to the restaurant and ordered food in good faith, and were now being treated like we had done something wrong.  The waitress just said ‘Well, we have Taco Tuesdays”.  What?  We actually said “We just told you we aren’t coming back, why are you telling us about other specials?”.  SO, this meal was a rollercoaster.  Apprehension about the condition of the restaurant, how bad it smelled, and the rudeness of the wait staff, then 180 degree turn around because of how amazing the food was, to anger, disappointment, and resentment over being treated like we had done something wrong and the complete refusal to take our coupon.  All things considered, the food was great, but if this is how a first time customer is treated, we will not be back, and will not recommend this place to any of our friends, which is sad, because there is a real lack of quality Mexican restaurants out there.  Thanks for lunch, Fogones, but we will not be back.  Ever.

data.title: dont waste your time
data.text: to start the front door glass was so busted up was afraid to go in /first sign / the place was almost empty on a Saturday afternoon / hmm second sign / opened the menu and looked at the prices and wow what could possibly be in Mexican food that could cost so much / beware this place way over priced !

data.title: Great Secret Gem
data.text:
Great little spot hidden in Shawnee. 

Good Guac, great mole.  Crab Cakes and street tacos were great as well.

Lots of cilantro!!!   So be ready.

data.title: Great Food in a Little Place in Shawnee, KS
data.text: Fogones will pleasantly surprise you.  The restaurant may be small but the flavor and the taste are BIG!  The food is authentic.  The drinks are tasty.  The staff is very friendly.  You have a choice of eating inside or outside on the patio.  Will be returning here many times!

data.title: A tasty treat!
data.text: Fogones is authentic and excellent Mexican cuisine. The chimichanga I had with grilled chicken was excellent. Crispy and flavorful, it was a real treat for my taste buds. The chips and salsa were yummy. Altogether a great luncheon experience, and we will be going back!

data.title: Awesome and Authentic
data.text: This is a great little place. Friendly and homey. Food is the best Mexican cuisine around. A can't miss proposition.

data.title: A local favorite
data.text: This is not your typical greasy burrito spot.  There are limited menu selections to choose from, but absolutely delicious.  You can tell that the food is prepared with fresh and high quality ingredients.  Nice, cozy atmosphere on the main strip, next to city hall.

data.title: Great except at Christmas
data.text: We love the food here because it is lighter than your average mexican fare, but more flavorsome.  We had hoped to take the family for a treat of a meal there shortly after Christmas but found the regular chef must have been on vacation, as it was not NEAR as good.  We were embarrassed and have not been back, but will soon, because it is worth the chance.

data.title: Nice change!
data.text: We were glad to find this restaurant. If you are looking for Mexican that is not your average fare this is the place to go. Small place but good food and they care about their customers.

data.title: Beyond-the-ordinary Mexican
data.text: This is not your ordinary Mexican food, this is way above and beyond the "standard" gloppy refried bean and yellow cheese dishes you might be used to.  I call it upscale Mexican: the names of many of the dishes on the menu you may be familiar with, but the way they are prepared is going to delight you!  The food is fresh and delicious with attention to detail.  I've been here many times and everything I have ordered was delicious.  Yesterday I had the chicken enchiladas and a Horchata drink and it was so good.  The building and the interior may be unassuming, but wait until your meal is served and you'll see why I like this Mexican restaurant so much.  If you're done with standard, less-than-terrific ubiquitous mexican food and are ready for something REALLY good, give Fogones a try.
